MM. Letâ€™s all meet up in the year 2000, wonâ€™t it be strange when weâ€™re all fully grown?

Iâ€™d pretty much just about landed what later turned into a career in web development, and I moved to London. Musically it wasnâ€™t going that well, though.

Honourable mentions

Coldplay - Parachutes

Another unpopular selection, I suspect. Donâ€™t care. Still love this album. Transmission OK - The Sky, The Stars And The Great Beyond

Wheatus - Wheatus

I honestly donâ€™t know how or where I heard Wheatus but when I did, I liked them. I bought the CD, and even took the (then) girlfriend to one of their gigs. We were about 26 or so, but we were the oldest people in the crowd. We pogoed for a couple of tracks, then went and leant against the bar. Cracking fun album though. :) Top track: â€œLove Is A Mutt From Hellâ€

Paul Gilbert - Alligator Farm

Pablo Gilberto! Yayyyy!

When PG split from Mr. Big to go solo, I hoovered up his albums with religious fervour, but for me it wasnâ€™t until this - his third - that he really clicked into gear. A splendid assemblage of tunes with Paulâ€™s omnipresent sense of fun running throughout, and of course a lot of insane guitar licks. But you really donâ€™t need to even be a rock-head to dig this album. His music isnâ€™t impenetrably widdly, itâ€™s if anything more pop-friendly than Mr. Bigâ€™s stuff, and somehow manages to fold his insane guitar playing into a collection of tunes youâ€™d happily play to your mum.

Thereâ€™s even a Spice Girls cover.

Seriously. There is.

No, really.

Top tracks: â€œAlligator Farmâ€, â€œIndividually Twistedâ€, â€œAttitude Boy Will Overcomeâ€
